thread.title: Nakano Starts Up 1.5MW Solar Plant in Saitama
thread.title_full: Nakano Starts Up 1.5MW Solar Plant in Saitama

title: Nakano Starts Up 1.5MW Solar Plant in Saitama
text:
Nakano Starts Up 1.5MW Solar Plant in Saitama Nakano Starts Up 1.5MW Solar Plant in Saitama 2015/09/03 18:55 Kenji Kaneko, Nikkei BP CleanTech Institute An image of the solar power plant (source: Nakano) 
Nakano Corp announced that it has built a solar power plant with an output of about 1.5MW in Higashimatsuyama City, Saitama Prefecture, Japan, and started a power generation business Aug 3, 2015. 
The mega (large-scale) solar power plant, "Nakanofudo Higashimatsuyama Mega Solar," was built on land that the company owns in Oaza Matsuyama, Higashimatsuyama City. 
The area of the site is about 26,000m 2 . Nakano, which is a medium-sized general contractor, aims to effectively use its assets, apply its know-how in solar power generation business to its construction business and strengthen the sales/marketing of solutions. 
Yuasa Trading Co Ltd provided EPC (engineering, procurement and construction) services. The solar panel and PV inverter employed for the plant are products of Canadian Solar Japan KK and Toshiba Mitsubishi-Electric Industrial Systems Corp (TMEIC), respectively. The plant is expected to generate 1,520,000kWh of electricity per year.
